Events that occurred on 27 October.

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1916 – J.R.R. Tolkien is struck by trench fever, which ends his contribution to the war after just 5 months.
1938 - Lascelles Abercrombie dies.
1943 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 51.
1966 - The second edition of The Lord of the Rings is published.
1968 - Barrels out of Bond, the fifth episode of the 1968 radio series of The Hobbit, is aired on BBC Radio.
1983 - The Book of Lost Tales: Part One is published in the UK.
1986 - Artist Jemima Catlin is born.
1992 - Sauron Defeated is published in the US.
1992 - Pictures by J.R.R. Tolkien (revised edition) is published.
1995 - J.R.R. Tolkien: Artist and Illustrator is published.
2005 - Tolkien's Modern Middle Ages is published.
2009 - Fantasy novel The Shadow Dragons, featuring J.R.R. Tolkien as a fictional character, is published.
2011 - The History of The Hobbit (revised one-volume edition) is published.
2011 - The Art of The Hobbit is published.
2011 - From Elvish to Klingon: Exploring Invented Languages is published.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
F.A. 495:
Tuor, guided by Voronwë, travels to Gondolin in order to deliver Ulmo's message to Turgon.
T.A. 3018:
Frodo and Samwise rest in Rivendell and prepare for their quest to destroy the One Ring.
